content: Tristan, thanks for writing such a thoughtful article! I love that you cover “what to do” as well as “what NOT to do”. As an analyst / data nerd who’s seen several small businesses struggle with analytics, I know that some businesses underestimate the importance of having clean and relevant data, but several others “jump the gun” and are totally obsessed with a level of analytics that the company is just not ready for. For any businesses out there who are exploring tools for analytics, remember that the data out is only as good as the data in. As such, don’t fall into the trap of “I have a GA account, therefore my company is data driven”. Invest the time and resources to understand each tool’s strengths and shortcomings, understand which suit your data best, and please (please PLEASEEEE) hire help to make sure all the data you’re tracking is accurate and actionable. Above all, be honest about the current needs and priorities of your company.
